syllabus_info.syllabus_name: Cambridge International AS & A Level Chemistry 9701

learning_objectives.description: state and explain the shapes of, and bond angles in, molecules by using VSEPR theory, including as simple examples: BF₃ (trigonal planar, 120°); CO₂ (linear, 180°); CH₄ (tetrahedral, 109.5°); NH₃ (pyramidal, 107°); H₂O (non-linear, 104.5°); SF₆ (octahedral, 90°); PF₅ (trigonal bipyramidal, 120° and 90°)
predict the shapes of, and bond angles in, molecules and ions analogous to those specified in 3.5.1
